problem_text: In the figure, C P is an altitude, C Q is the angle bisector of \angle A C B, and R is the midpoint of A B. Find m \angle A C Q if m \angle A C B = 123 - x and m \angle Q C B = 42 + x.
compact_text: In the figure, CP is an altitude, CQ is the angle bisector of \angle ACB, and R is the midpoint of AB. Find m \angle ACQ if m \angle ACB = 123-x and m \angle QCB = 42+x.
annotat_text: In the figure, $\overline{CP}$ is an altitude, $\overline{CQ}$ is the angle bisector of $∠ACB$, and $R$ is the midpoint of $\overline{AB}$. Find  $m∠ACQ$ if $m∠ACB=123-x$ and $m∠QCB = 42 + x$.
